name: bet UMi
scenarioDescription:
The bet UMi Exoplanetary System

bet UMi is a star with 1.4 times the mass of the Sun, and 38.3 times its radius. It is located 126.48 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 2.95 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

bet UMi is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.

bet UMi b

bet UMi b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-06. Its semi-major axis is 1.40 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 522.30 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, bet UMi.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.19, which means that when bet UMi b is at is at its closest point to its host star, 1.13 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 1.67. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of bet UMi b is 1938.64 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, bet UMi b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system bet UMi, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
